casebody.data:
UNITED STATES, Appellee, v. A CARGO OF ABOUT 7,346 TONS OF LINSEED Laden on the Steamship West Totant, Respondent; Bolle Watson Company, Inc., Appellant. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. November 12, 1928. No. 2. Edward J. Dowling and Graham, McMahon, Buell & Knox, all of New York City (Edward Ward McMahon and George D. Bradford, both of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Charles H. Tuttle, of New York City (Walter Schaffner, Sp. Asst. U. S. Atty., of Ñew York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before L. HAND, SWAN, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree [20 F.(2d) 199] affirmed.
